page.title: 03General Description 3
page.content: be carried out.The colliery also had a cokeworks attatched to it but this was closed and demolished by 1958 when a new cokeworks had been built about 5 miles away at Hawthorn. The colliery needed many workers and the owners of the mine began to build the houses necessary for the miners and their families.The houses were originally built as two or three up and two down terraced houses with outside toilets and coalhouses.The very first houses of this type were demolished in the mid 1970's but many of the houses have been modernised and now provide very comfortable homes, though they still look very depressing from the outside and they still do not have any gardens.
